bug.short_desc: 'dnf updateinfo' reports on already installed updates
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Recently, 'dnf updateinfo info' for me has started reporting information about updates that are already installed. This makes it hard to sort out information for new updates (and sometimes it doesn't show those either, although I don't have a reproduction since it is hard to spot in the noise).
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
dnf-1.1.10-5.fc25.noarch
How reproducible:
At the moment it appears reliable.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 'dnf clean metadata' : root:hawkwind.cs ;; dnf clean metadata 62 files removed
2. 'dnf check-update', and see that it reports no updates pending:
: root:hawkwind.cs ;; dnf check-update Adobe Systems Incorporated 21 kB/s | 2.0 kB 00:00 google-chrome-x86_64 8.2 kB/s | 3.6 kB 00:00 Fedora 25 - x86_64 37 MB/s | 50 MB 00:01 Fedora 25 - x86_64 - Updates 5.0 MB/s | 20 MB 00:04 RPM Fusion for Fedora 25 - Nonfree - Up 6.0 kB/s | 20 kB 00:03 RPM Fusion for Fedora 25 - Nonfree 1.6 MB/s | 144 kB 00:00 Adobe Systems Incorporated 20 kB/s | 2.0 kB 00:00 RPM Fusion for Fedora 25 - Free 3.0 MB/s | 515 kB 00:00 RPM Fusion for Fedora 25 - Free - Updat 221 kB/s | 254 kB 00:01 Last metadata expiration check: 0:00:01 ago on Tue Mar 14 11:35:07 2017.
3. 'dnf updateinfo info' and get a bunch of things reported.
4. 'rpm -q <package>' and see that it is the same version as the claimed update.
Actual results:
: root:hawkwind.cs ;; dnf updateinfo info Last metadata expiration check: 0:01:17 ago on Tue Mar 14 11:35:07 2017. =============================================================================== freetype-2.6.5-3.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-c09c0cc384 Type : security Updated : 2017-03-12 12:21:58 Bugs : 1429968 - CVE-2016-10244 freetype: parse_charstrings function in type1/t1load.c does not ensure that a font contains a glyph name [fedora-all] Description : This update fixes a possible heap buffer overflow.
=============================================================================== gnutls-3.5.10-1.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-5a55b061cb Type : enhancement Updated : 2017-03-07 04:11:32 Description : - Update to upstream 3.5.10 release
=============================================================================== gtk3-3.22.9-2.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-ce763afcbe Type : bugfix Updated : 2017-03-05 16:50:59 Bugs : 1428280 - Wayland: spurious key repeat with gtk 3.22.9 in gnome-terminal Description : gtk+ 3.22.9 release. : : Bugs fixed: : : * 136059 Ctrl-navigation works in opposite direction in right-to-left text : * 776821 Scale factor not properly propagated upon reparent : * 778203 icon shown at top left corner when dnd begins : * 778328 Pressure sensitivity lost after removing pen from screen (Surface Book/MyPaint) : * 778534 Widget: Document signal mnemonic-activate : * 778678 gtkshow: Prefer gtk_show_uri_on_window() which works for sandboxed apps : * 778726 Use gtk_show_uri_on_window() : * 778746 Rename popover is sometimes misplaced : * 778835 Wrong screen size returned when in HiDPI mode : * 778905 Frame: documented flat style class is not usable : * 779005 GtkFrame: Fix shadow after theme changes : * 136059 Ctrl-navigation works in opposite direction in right-to-left text : * 772505 Wayland: menu does not resize after disabling an action : * 774148 Gtk.Popover misplacement in Wayland : * 778019 Key repeat under wayland behaves differently, making keyboard navigation e.g. in vim annoyingly unreliable
=============================================================================== hunspell-1.4.1-2.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-da63982ed2 Type : enhancement Updated : 2017-03-08 03:22:14 Bugs : 1429258 - hunspell fails with floating point exception when using custom user spelling dictionary Description : * crash with empty local dictionary
=============================================================================== krb5-1.14.4-7.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-bd92beb051 Type : bugfix Updated : 2017-03-07 04:11:32 Description : Fix observed issues in last update.
=============================================================================== libICE-1.0.9-8.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-c02eb668a7 Type : security Updated : 2017-03-03 12:05:44 Bugs : 1427715 - CVE-2017-2626 libICE: weak entropy usage in session keys [fedora-all] Description : Security fix for CVE-2017-2626
=============================================================================== libepoxy-1.4.1-1.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-b169865480 Type : enhancement Updated : 2017-03-10 04:58:41 Description : libepoxy 1.4.1
=============================================================================== java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.121-8.b14.fc25 nss-3.28.3-1.0.fc25 nss-softokn-3.28.3-1.1.fc25 nss-util-3.28.3-1.0.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-f66b383735 Type : bugfix Updated : 2017-03-03 12:05:44 Bugs : 1423421 - java-1.8.0-openjdk: javadoc crashes on valid Java source : 1415137 - java-1.8.0-openjdk: NSS 3.28 update causes core dump Description : This is a combined update of the java-1.8.0-openjdk and nss packages, that contains a fix for an NSS ABI issue. : : nss: : : * The incompatible NSS ABI, which had accidently been introduced in NSS versions 3.28, 3.28.1, 3.28.2 and 3.29 has been fixed, and original compatibility has been restored. : * please rebuild your application, if it directly accesses nss-softokn interfaces : : java-1.8.0-openjdk: : : * you MUST update to the softokn-3.28.3 to use this java-1.8.0-openjdk package : * secondary (and mainly) issue with config files leftovers was (hopefully) finally resolved : * so except NSS you will get aligned also copy-jdk-configs to 2.2 : * please remove any old .rpmsave or .rpmnew or any other other rpm backups of those files ahead this release : * note that those may be in different directories (still in /usr/share/java/java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0*) : * in addition, many small bugficxes (like 1423421) were included
=============================================================================== pango-1.40.4-1.fc25 =============================================================================== Update ID : FEDORA-2017-a4169a5ba1 Type : bugfix Updated : 2017-03-02 17:38:19 Description : pango 1.40.4 release. : : - Fix some Coverity findings (#778601, #778602, #778654, #778656) : - Fix introspection annotation of pango_lkayout_get_size (#779232)
: root:hawkwind.cs ;; rpm -q pango pango-1.40.4-1.fc25.x86_64 pango-1.40.4-1.fc25.i686 : root:hawkwind.cs ;; rpm -q freetype freetype-2.6.5-3.fc25.x86_64 freetype-2.6.5-3.fc25.i686 : root:hawkwind.cs ;; rpm -q gnutls hunspell gnutls-3.5.10-1.fc25.x86_64 gnutls-3.5.10-1.fc25.i686 hunspell-1.4.1-2.fc25.x86_64 hunspell-1.4.1-2.fc25.i686
Expected results:
No output from 'dnf updateinfo info' when there are no pending updates.
Additional info:
'dnf updateinfo info updates' produces no output, as expected. 'dnf updateinfo info available' produces the same output as with no third argument.

I am sorry, but I cannot reproduce it with dnf-2.1.1-1. This version can be tested in rawhide, or from our testing repository for fedora 24 and later versions ("dnf copr enable rpmsoftwaremanagement/dnf-nightly"). Please if the problem reappear don't hesitate to reopen it.
